com.ibm.streamsx.topology.spi

Interface FunctionalOperator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    com.ibm.streamsx.topology.internal.functional.ops.AbstractPipe, com.ibm.streamsx.topology.internal.functional.ops.AbstractPrimitive, ForEach, com.ibm.streamsx.topology.internal.functional.ops.FunctionSource, Pipe, Primitive, Source

    public interface FunctionalOperator
extends java.io.Closeable
    A functional for each (sink) operator. This is part of the SPI to allow additional functional style functionality to built using the primitives provided by this toolkit. Only methods explicitly declared in this class are part of the API. Use of super-class methods (except those defined by java.lang.Object) is not recommended and such methods may change or be removed at any time.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        default void initialize()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Operator initialization. This implementation does nothing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getStreamsContext

        com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext getStreamsContext()
        Return the Streams Operator context. This allows full access to the Streams runtime environment.
        Returns:
        Streams operator context for this functional operator.

      • getFunctionContext

        FunctionContext getFunctionContext()
        Get the functional context seen by the logic. This is effectively a clean subset of OperatorContext that hides any operator specific functionality.

      • exception

        default java.lang.Throwable exception(java.lang.Exception e)
        Return the exception to be thrown on failure. Allows a service provided to throw a specific exception for a failure. Default implementation is to return e.
        Parameters:
        e - Cause of failure.
        Returns:
        Exception to be thrown.
